name: Performing with Cameras
description: This course investigates the relationship of the body to the camera. Using both still and video cameras and live performance students will create works that unite the performative and the mediated image. The course will cover how the body is framed and represented in contemporary art, advertising and the media.
prerequisites: VPHA46H3 and [2.0 credits at the B- or C-level in VPS courses including 0.5 credit taken from: VPSB58H3, VPSB67H3, VPSB75H3, VPSB76H3, or VPSB77H3]; students enrolled in the Specialist and Major programs in Studio Art must also complete ACMB01H3
